item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works. (text of measure as introduced: CR S6228)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6228)

summary.text: Spent Nuclear Fuel Tracking and Accountability Act - Directs the Nuclear Regulatory Commission to: (1) establish specific and uniform guidelines for tracking, controlling, and accounting for individual spent fuel rods or segments at nuclear power plants, including procedures for conducting physical inventories; (2) establish uniform inspection procedures to verify any action taken by a nuclear power plant to implement those guidelines; and (3) submit to Congress a status report describing the progress of the Commission in establishing such guidelines.

bill.title: Spent Nuclear Fuel Tracking and Accountability Act

item.title: Spent Nuclear Fuel Tracking and Accountability Act
Spent Nuclear Fuel Tracking and Accountability Act
A bill to direct the Nuclear Regulatory Commission to establish guidelines and procedures for tracking, controlling, and accounting for individual spent fuel rods and segments.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works. (text of measure as introduced: CR S6228)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
